text: All men are by nature equal, made all of the same earth by one Workman and however we deceive ourselves, as dear unto God is the poor peasant as the mighty prince.
author: Plato

text: Men's actions are too strong for them. Show me a man who has acted, and who has not been the victim and slave of his action.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Men love to wonder, and that is the seed of science.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: There is a blessed necessity by which the interest of men is always driving them to the right and, again, making all crime mean and ugly.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: If you want to sacrifice the admiration of many men for the criticism of one, go ahead, get married.
author: Katharine Hepburn
